titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, Lewis E 149: Libellus beati misericordes (A collection of excerpts from the latin fathers)
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript contains a collection of excerpts from the Latin Fathers.

msItem.title: Libellus beati misericordes (A collection of excerpts from the latin fathers)

supportDesc.extent: ii+88+i; 152 x 103 mm bound to 160 x 114 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

collation.p: No evidence of catchwords or signatures; structure uncertain

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled in ink; one column of twenty-one lines; pricking evident; written area: 114 x 80 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: One- and two-line initials in red throughout; rubrication throughout

binding.p: Eighteenth-century red-brown morocco (Belgian?) with a dolphin crest

history.provenance: Written for Carthusian use in the archdiocese of Cambrai, now north of France; early ownership inscription of the Carthusians of Enghien, in Hainaut; R. Henry; Rudolph Frederick Kelker, Harrisburg, PA: his sale, Henkels, Philadelphia, June 11, 1908, no. 43; (directly to?) John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936; Contemporary ownership inscription on front flyleaf of a Carthusian monastery near Enghien in Belgium, where ms may have been written: "Lib(er) do[mus] capelle b[eati] ma[riae] v[ir]g[ini]s iux[t]a a[n]gia[m] ord carth."
